description: The PV2 segment is a continuation of visit-specific information contained on the PV1 segment.

1.name: Prior Pending Location
1.description: This field is required for cancel pending transfer (A27 (cancel pending admit)) messages. In all other events it is optional.

10.name: Estimated Length of Inpatient Stay
10.description: This field specifies the estimated days of inpatient stays.

11.name: Actual Length of Inpatient Stay
11.description: This field contains the actual days of inpatient stays. The actual length of the inpatient stay may not be calculated from the admission and discharge dates because of possible leaves of absence.

12.name: Visit Description
12.description: This field contains a brief user-defined description of the visit.

13.name: Referral Source Code
13.description: This field contains the name and the identification numbers of the person or organization that made the referral. This person/organization is not the same as the referring doctor. For example, Joe Smith referred me to the Clinic (or to Dr. Jones at the Clinic).
13.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

14.name: Previous Service Date
14.description: This field contains the date of previous service for the same recurring condition. This may be a required field for billing certain illnesses (e.g., accident related) to a third party.

15.name: Employment Illness Related Indicator
15.description: This field specifies whether a patient's illness was job-related. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
15.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

16.name: Purge Status Code
16.description: This field contains the purge status code for the account. It is used by the application program to determine purge processing. Refer to user-defined table 0213 - Purge status for suggested values.
16.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

17.name: Purge Status Date
17.description: This field contains the date on which the data will be purged from the system.

18.name: Special Program Code
18.description: This field designates the specific health insurance program for a visit required for healthcare reimbursement. Examples include Child Health Assistance, Elective Surgery Program, Family Planning, etc. User-defined table 0214 - Special program codes is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.
18.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

19.name: Retention Indicator
19.description: This field allows the user to control the financial and demographic purge processes at the visit. It is used to preserve demographic and financial data on specific, high priority visits. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
19.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

2.name: Accommodation Code
2.description: This field indicates the specific patient accommodations for this visit. User-defined table 0129 - Accommodation code is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table for values for this field.

20.name: Expected Number of Insurance Plans
20.description: This field contains the number of insurance plans that may provide coverage for this visit.

21.name: Visit Publicity Code
21.description: This field contains a user-defined code indicating what level of publicity is allowed (e.g., No Publicity, Family Only) for a specific visit. User-defined table 0215 - Publicitycode is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. Refer to PD1-11- publicity code for the patient level publicity code.
21.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

22.name: Visit Protection Indicator
22.description: This field identifies the person's protection that determines, in turn, whether access to information about this person should be kept from users who do not have adequate authority for a specific visit. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values. Refer to PD1-12- protection indicator for the patient level protection indicator.
22.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

23.name: Clinic Organization Name
23.description: This field contains the organization name or sub-unit and identifier that is associated with the (visit) episode of care. For example, the Allergy or Oncology Clinic within the facility might be named.
23.data_type: XON - Extended Composite Name And Identification Number For Organizations

24.name: Patient Status Code
24.description: This field indicates the status of the episode of care: for instance, Active Inpatient vs. Discharged Inpatient. Refer to user defined table0216 - Patient status for suggested values.
24.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

25.name: Visit Priority Code
25.description: This field contains the priority of the visit, e.g., whether the admission is an emergency, elective, or urgent. Refer to user defined table 0217 - Visit priority for suggested values.
25.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

26.name: Previous Treatment Date
26.description: This field contains the date that the patient last had treatment for any condition prior to this visit. In the case of a prior hospital visit, it is likely to be the previous discharge date.

27.name: Expected Discharge Disposition
27.description: This field describes what the patient's disposition is expected to be at the end of the visit. Refer to user-defined table 0112 - Discharged disposition for suggested values.
27.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

28.name: Signature on File Date
28.description: This field contains the date on which a signature was obtained for insurance billing purposes.

29.name: First Similar Illness Date
29.description: This field is used to determine if the patient has a pre-existing condition.

3.name: Admit Reason
3.description: This field contains the short description of the reason for patient admission.

30.name: Patient Charge Adjustment Code
30.description: This field contains a user-defined code that indicates which adjustments should be made to this patient's charges. User-defined table 0218 - Charge adjustment is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. This field is the same as GT1-26-guarantor charge adjustment code .

31.name: Recurring Service Code
31.description: This field indicates whether the treatment is continuous. User-defined table 0219 - Recurring service is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.
31.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

32.name: Billing Media Code
32.description: This field indicates if the account is to be rejected from tape billing. Refer to Chapter 2 , HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
32.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

33.name: Expected Surgery Date & Time
33.description: This field contains the date and time on which the surgery is expected to occur.

34.name: Military Partnership Code
34.description: This field indicates that a military facility has contracted with a non-military facility for the use of its services. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
34.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

35.name: Military Non-Availability Code
35.description: This field indicates whether a patient has permission to use a non-military facility for treatment. Refer to Chapter 2 , HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
35.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

36.name: Newborn Baby Indicator
36.description: This field indicates whether the patient is a baby. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
36.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

37.name: Baby Detained Indicator
37.description: This field indicates if the baby is detained after the mother's discharge. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.
37.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

4.name: Transfer Reason
4.description: This field contains the short description of the reason for a patient location change.

5.name: Patient Valuables
5.description: This field contains the short description of patient valuables checked in during admission.

6.name: Patient Valuables Location
6.description: This field indicates the location of the patient's valuables.

7.name: Visit User Code
7.description: This field further categorizes a patient's visit with respect to an individual institution's needs (e.g., teaching flag = TE, indicating the patient is a teaching case). User-defined table 0130 - Visit user code is used as the HL7 identifier or the user-defined table of values for this field.
7.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

8.name: Expected Admit Date/Time
8.description: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be admitted. This field is also used to reflect the date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient registration.

9.name: Expected Discharge Date/Time
9.description: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be discharged. This is a non-event related date used by ancillaries to determine more accurately the projected workloads. This field is also used to reflect the anticipated discharge date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient, or an inpatient.
